member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.AuthenticationProviders.AuthenticationProviderExtensions.LoadIcon(Gemstone.Security.AuthenticationProviders.IAuthenticationProvider)
member.summary: Loads an icon from embedded resources associated with the authentication provider.
member.param: The provider which is visually represented by the icon
member.returns: The icon associated with the provider.

remarks.para: Supported file types are jpg, png, gif, svg, and webp.
For a hypothetical ExampleProvider in the Gemstone.Example namespace, the embedded resource name for a jpg icon would be Gemstone.Example.ExampleProvider.jpg.
Expect that icons will be rendered in an approximately square space, 32 pixels tall. Therefore, a good target size would be 32x32, but it can be a bit wider or narrower.

member.name: T:Gemstone.Security.AuthenticationProviders.IAuthenticationProvider
member.summary: Represents a provider of claims for an authentication provider.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.AuthenticationProviders.IAuthenticationProvider.FindClaims(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Find claims that can be returned by the authentication provider.
member.param: The type of claim to search for
Text used to narrow the results for the search for claims
member.returns: A collection of claims matching the search text.
member.remarks: Search text can include asterisks as wildcards. To include a literal asterisk, use backslash as the escape character. A literal backslash can be escaped by another backslash. Any other character escaped by a backslash matches the character; the backslash will be removed.
member.exception: The claim type is not supported

member.name: T:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher
member.summary: Provides general use cryptographic functions.
member.remarks: This class exists to simplify usage of basic cryptography functionality.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.ConfigDecrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts a configuration setting in the format of "KeyName:EncodedValue" that was previously encrypted using the method using a key size.
member.param: Encoded configuration setting value.

remarks.para: If no key name is specified, value is assumed to not be encoded and is returned as is.
It is recommended to use this method at the last possible moment, e.g., in stack variables, to avoid storing decrypted data in memory for longer periods of time.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength)
member.summary: Returns a binary array of decrypted data for the given parameters.
member.param: Binary array of data to decrypt.
Encryption key to use to decrypt data.
Initialization vector to use to decrypt data.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting data.
member.returns: A decrypted version of the source data.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength)
member.summary: Returns a binary array of decrypted data for the given parameters.
member.param: Binary array of data to decrypt.
Offset into buffer.
Number of bytes in buffer to decrypt starting from offset.
Encryption key to use to decrypt data.
Initialization vector to use to decrypt data.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting data.
member.returns: A decrypted version of the source data.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength)
member.summary: Returns a binary array of decrypted data for the given parameters.
member.param: Binary array of data to decrypt.
Offset into buffer.
Number of bytes in buffer to decrypt starting from offset.
User password used for key lookup.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting data.
member.returns: A decrypted version of the source data.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.String,Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength)
member.summary: Returns a binary array of decrypted data for the given parameters.
member.param: Binary array of data to decrypt.
User password used for key lookup.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting data.
member.returns: A decrypted version of the source data.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Decrypt(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength)
member.summary: Returns a stream of decrypted data for the given parameters.
member.param: Source stream that contains data to decrypt.
Encryption key to use to decrypt stream.
Initialization vector to use to decrypt stream.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting stream.
member.returns: A decrypted version of the source stream.
member.remarks: This returns a memory stream of the decrypted results, if the incoming stream is very large this will consume a large amount of memory. In this case use the overload that takes the destination stream as a parameter instead.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Decrypt(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength,System.Action{Gemstone.ProcessProgress{System.Int64}})
member.summary: Decrypts input stream onto output stream for the given parameters.
member.param: Source stream that contains data to decrypt.
Destination stream used to hold decrypted data.
Encryption key to use to decrypt stream.
Initialization vector to use to decrypt stream.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting stream.
Optional delegate to handle progress updates for decrypting large streams.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Decrypt(System.String,System.String,Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength)
member.summary: Returns a decrypted string from a Base64 encoded string of binary encrypted data from the given parameters.
member.param: Source string to decrypt.
User password used for key lookup.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting string.
member.returns: A decrypted version of the source string.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.DecryptFile(System.String,System.String,System.String,Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength,System.Action{Gemstone.ProcessProgress{System.Int64}})
member.summary: Creates a decrypted file from source file data.
member.param: Source file name.
Destination file name.
User password used for key lookup.
Cryptographic strength to use when decrypting file.
Optional delegate to handle progress updates for decrypting large files.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.Encrypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.CipherStrength)
member.summary: Returns a binary array of encrypted data for the given parameters.
member.param: Binary array of data to encrypt.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.ExportKeyIV(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Exports a key and initialization vector from the local system key cache.
member.param: User password used for key lookup.
Specifies the desired key size.
member.returns: Text based key and initialization vector exported from local key cache.
member.remarks: This method is used to manually export a key to be installed on another computer.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.FlushCache(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks current thread and waits for any pending save of local system key cache to complete.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait, or (-1) to wait indefinitely.

remarks.para: This method only needs to be used if crypto cache changes could be pending during application shutdown (i.e., executing ciphers with new keys that have not been saved, using existing keys does not queue crypto cache updates) to ensure keys are flushed before exit.

For most applications it is expected that this method would rarely be needed. However, possible usage scenarios would include:
Writing an application that establishes crypto keys where application lifetime would be very short (i.e., run, create keys, exit).
Creating new crypto keys during application shutdown (i.e., performing ciphers with non-existing keys at shutdown).

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.GetPasswordHash(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the Base64 encoded SHA-256 hash of given user password.
member.param: User password to get hash for.
Specifies the optional category ID.
member.returns: Base64 encoded SHA-256 hash of user password.
member.remarks: The optional will be appended to the to allow the same password to be used in different contexts and return different results, when useful.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Cipher.ImportKeyIV(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Imports a key and initialization vector into the local system key cache.
member.param: User password used for key lookups.
Specifies the desired key size.
Text based key and initialization vector to import into local key cache.
member.remarks: This method is used to manually import a key created on another computer.

member.returns: true if a key and initialization vector exists for the given ; otherwise false.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2.CsharpMaxBlocksPerArray
member.summary: C# has a limit of 0X7FEFFFFF elements per array (0x7FFFFFC7 per byte array). The blocks are 1024 bytes long, the elements are 8 bytes (ulong). This gives 0X7FEFFFFF / 128 blocks per C# array.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2.Dispose
member.summary: Zero sensitive memories and dispose of resources.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2.FixedTimeEquals(Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.ZeroedBuffer{System.Byte},Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.ZeroedBuffer{System.Byte})
member.summary: Compare two ZeroedBuffers without leaking timing information.
member.param: The first ZeroedBuffer to compare.
The second ZeroedBuffer to compare.
member.returns: true if left and right have the same values for Length and the same contents; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Uses System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicOperations.FixedTimeEquals() when available; otherwise implements a similar algorithm.

member.summary: Hash the given password to an Argon2 hash string.
member.param: Contains all the information used to create the hash returned.
member.returns: The Argon2 hash of the given password.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2.Hash(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Type,System.Int32)
member.summary: Hash the given password to an Argon2 hash string.
member.param: The password to hash. Gets UTF-8 encoded before hashing.
The secret to use in creating the hash.
The time cost to use. Defaults to 3.
The target memory cost to use. Defaults to 65536 (65536 * 1024 = 64MB). for detail on calculating the actual memory used from this value.
The parallelism to use. Default to 1 (single threaded).
Data-dependent, data-independent, or hybrid. Defaults to hybrid (as recommended for password hashing).
The length of the hash in bytes. Note, the string returned base-64 encodes this with other parameters so the resulting string is significantly longer.
member.returns: The Argon2 hash of the given password.

Data-dependent, data-independent, or hybrid. Defaults to hybrid (as recommended for password hashing).
The length of the hash in bytes. Note, the string returned base-64 encodes this with other parameters so the resulting string is significantly longer.
member.returns: The Argon2 hash of the given password.

The target memory cost to use. Defaults to 65536 (65536 * 1024 = 64MB). for detail on calculating the actual memory used from this value.
The parallelism to use. Default to 1 (single threaded).

member.summary: The number of bytes hashed in initializing Argon2.

member.summary: Bytes required in the buffer passed into the method.

member.summary: The number of 8-byte words in an Argon2 block.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2.SegmentBlockCount
member.summary: Gets the number of memory blocks per segment. This value gets derived from the memory cost. The memory cost value is a request for that number of blocks. If that request is less than (2 * ) times the number of lanes requested, it is first bumped up to that amount. Then, it may be reduced to fit on a times the number of lanes requested boundary.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2.SyncPointCount
member.summary: Number of synchronization points between lanes per pass.

The password to verify. This gets UTF-8 encoded.
The secret used in the creation of . UTF-8 encoded to create the byte-buffer actually used in the verification. May be null for no secret. string.Empty is treated as null.

member.name: T:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config
member.summary: Holds configuration needed to perform an Argon2 hash.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.AssociatedData
member.summary: Gets or sets the associated data used in the password hash.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.ClearPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to clear the password as soon as it is no longer needed.
member.remarks: If true and the configuration has a password, the configuration cannot be used more than once without resetting the password (unless you want an all zero password).

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.ClearSecret
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to clear the secret as soon as it is no longer needed.
member.remarks: If true and the configuration has a secret, the configuration cannot be used more than once without resetting the secret (unless you want an all zero secret).

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.HashLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the hash length to output. Minimum of 4. Default 32.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.Lanes
member.summary: Gets or sets the lanes used in the password hash. Minimum of 1. Defaults to 4.
member.remarks: This describes the maximum parallelism that can be achieved. Each "lane" can be processed individually in its own thread. Setting to a value greater than one when there is more than one lane will allow the use of multiple cores to speed up hashing.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.MemoryCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the memory cost used in the password hash. Minimum of 1. Defaults to 65536.

remarks.para: This translates into a target count of memory blocks to use for hashing. A memory block is 1024 bytes so the default 65536 is for a 64MB hash.
If this value is less than 2**, than 2** will be used.
If this value is not a multiple of *, then it is rounded down to a multiple of *.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to hash.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.Salt
member.summary: Gets or sets the salt used in the password hash. If non-null, must be at least 8 bytes.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.Secret
member.summary: Gets or sets the secret used in the password hash.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.Threads
member.summary: Gets or sets the threads used in the password hash. Minimum of 1. Defaults to 1.

remarks.para: This value makes no difference in the result. A value greater than one causes that many threads to get spawned to do the work on top of the main thread that orchestrates which thread does what work.
defines the maximum parallelism that can be achieved. Setting to a value greater than will not result in more than threads running.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.TimeCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the time cost used in the password hash. Minimum of 1. Defaults to 3.
member.remarks: This is the number of iterations to perform. There are attacks on the . with less than three iterations (if I'm reading the paper correctly). So, use a value greater than 3 here if you are not using . .

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the Argon2 type. Default to hybrid.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the Argon2 version used in the password hash. Defaults to . (0x13).

member.name: T:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Type
member.summary: Argon2 can hash in two different ways, data-dependent and data-independent.

remarks.para: From the Argon2 paper:

Argon2 has two variants: Argon2d [data-dependent] and Argon2i [data-independent]. Argon2d is faster and uses data-depending memory access, which makes it suitable for crypto-currencies and applications with no threats from side-channel timing attacks. Argon2i uses data-independent memory access, which is preferred for password hashing and password-based key derivation. Argon2i is slower as it makes more passes over the memory to protect from tradeoff attacks.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Type.DataDependentAddressing
member.summary: Use data-dependent addressing. This is faster but susceptible to side-channel attacks.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Type.DataIndependentAddressing
member.summary: Use data-independent addressing. This is slower and recommended for password hashing and password-based key derivation.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Type.HybridAddressing
member.summary: Use a hybrid of data-dependent and data-independent addressing.

member.name: T:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Version
member.summary: There are two versions, 16 and 19. 19 is 5%-15% slower but fixes a vulnerability where an attacker could take advantage of short time spans where memory blocks were not used to reduce the overall memory cost by up to a factor of about 3.5.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Version.Sixteen
member.summary: For Argon2 versions 1.2.1 or earlier.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Version.Nineteen
member.summary: For Argon2 version 1.3.

member.param: The configuration to populate with the data found in .
The string to decode.
Loaded with the hash found in ; set to null if does not contain a hash.
member.returns: True on success; false otherwise. set to null on failure.

remarks.para: Expected format:
$argon2<T>[$v=<num>]$m=<num>,t=<num>,p=<num>[,keyid=<bin>][,data=<bin>][$<bin>[$<bin>]].

where <T> is either 'd' or 'i', <num> is a decimal integer (positive, fits in an 'unsigned long'), and <bin> is Base64-encoded data (no '=' padding characters, no newline or whitespace). The "keyid" is a binary identifier for a key (up to 8 bytes); "data" is associated data (up to 32 bytes). When the 'keyid' (resp. the 'data') is empty, then it is omitted from the output.

The last two binary chunks (encoded in Base64) are, in that order, the salt and the output. Both are optional, but you cannot have an output without a salt. The binary salt length is between 8 and 48 bytes. The output length is always exactly 32 bytes.

member.name: T:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.EncodeExtension
member.summary: Extension to encode an Argon2 hash string.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.EncodeExtension.EncodeString(Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Argon2Hash.Argon2Config,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes an Argon2 instance into a string.
member.param: To encode.
The hash to put in the encoded string. May be null.

remarks.para: Resulting format:
$argon2<T>[$v=<num>]$m=<num>,t=<num>,p=<num>[,keyid=<bin>][,data=<bin>][$<bin>[$<bin>]].

where <T> is either 'd' or 'i', <num> is a decimal integer (positive, fits in an 'unsigned long'), and <bin> is Base64-encoded data (no '=' padding characters, no newline or whitespace). The "keyid" is a binary identifier for a key (up to 8 bytes); "data" is associated data (up to 32 bytes). When the 'keyid' (resp. the 'data') is empty, then it is omitted from the output.

The last two binary chunks (encoded in Base64) are, in that order, the salt and the output. Both are optional, but you cannot have an output without a salt. The binary salt length is between 8 and 48 bytes. The output length is always exactly 32 bytes.

member.summary: Make an Argon2 B64 string which is an RFC 4648 Base64 string without the trailing '=' padding.
member.param: The buffer to convert to a string.

member.name: F:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2B.OutputLength
member.summary: The output length of the Blake2 hash in bytes.

remarks.para: This is the maximum length buffer a Blake2 hash can produce Blake2 will always hash to this length even when configured to hash to a shorter value - the final step is to truncate the result.

Note, the length of the expected result is hashed into the result so the -byte buffer will hold different values depending on the configured output length. Do not run Blake2 using the default length and then truncate and expect to get the same result as if you configured Blake2 to produce a shorter result.

member.name: T:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig
member.summary: Configuration for the Blake2 hash.

member.name: M:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets the key value used in the hash. If not null, must be 128 bytes or shorter.
member.remarks: Blake2 keyed hashing can be used for authentication as a faster and simpler replacement for HMAC.
member.exception: Attempt to set greater than 128 bytes.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig.OutputSizeInBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the output size in bits. Must be a multiple of 8.
member.exception: Attempt to set to a value not a multiple of 8 bits.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig.OutputSizeInBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the output size in bytes. Must be less than or equal to 64.
member.remarks: Blake2 incorporates this value into the hash. The array returned by the . call will be this length unless the value is non-null. If that property is non-null, that buffer gets returned by the . call regardless of the property. In that case, you can copy the first bytes of the array to get the value that Blake2 would have returned.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig.Personalization
member.summary: Gets or sets the personalization value used in the hash. If not null, must be 16 bytes.
member.exception: Attempt to set to non-null other than 16 bytes.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig.Result64ByteBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the 64-byte result buffer the Blake2 algorithm will use.
member.remarks: If not null, this is the buffer that will get returned by the . call regardless of the value of .
member.exception: Attempt to set to non-null other than 64 bytes.

member.name: P:Gemstone.Security.Cryptography.Blake2BHash.Blake2BConfig.Salt
member.summary: Gets or sets the salt value used in the hash. If not null, must be 16 bytes.
member.exception: Attempt to set to non-null other than 16 bytes.
